channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: At least one dead after small plane crashes in upstate New York
item.description: A twin-engine plane with six people on board crashed Saturday in a muddy field in upstate New York, authorities said.
item.content:encoded: A twin-engine plane with six people on board crashed Saturday in a muddy field in upstate New York, authorities said.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Convalescing Pope Francis opens Holy Week with greeting in St. Peter's Square
item.description: A convalescing Pope Francis greeted the crowd in St. Peter's Square on Palm Sunday, in yet another reassuring public sign of his recovery from a life-threatening battle with double pneumonia.
item.content:encoded:
A convalescing Pope Francis greeted the crowd in St. Peter's Square on Palm Sunday, in yet another reassuring public sign of his recovery from a life-threatening battle with double pneumonia.

(Image credit: Gregorio Borgia)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: More than 30 people killed in Russian missile attack on Ukrainian city of Sumy
item.description: More than 30 people were killed in a Russian missile strike on the Ukrainian city of Sumy on Sunday, officials said.
item.content:encoded:
More than 30 people were killed in a Russian missile strike on the Ukrainian city of Sumy on Sunday, officials said.

(Image credit: AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: A retrial of Sarah Palin's case against 'New York Times' begins Monday
item.description: Former Alaska Gov. Sarah Palin has the rare opportunity to retry her defamation case against The New York Times even though she lost it — twice in a 24-hour-period — in early 2022.
item.content:encoded:
The New York Times is slated to begin Monday.'/>

Former Alaska Gov. Sarah Palin has the rare opportunity to retry her defamation case against The New York Times even though she lost it — twice in a 24-hour-period — in early 2022.

(Image credit: Justin Sullivan/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: David Folkenflik

item.title: Will the SAVE Act make it harder for married women to vote? We ask legal experts
item.description: Legal experts say states could help married women who have changed their last names by accepting documents like a legal decree or a marriage certificate, but it might not fix the issue for all.
item.content:encoded:
Legal experts say states could help married women who have changed their last names by accepting documents like a legal decree or a marriage certificate, but it might not fix the issue for all.

(Image credit: Kamil Krzaczynski)
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim

item.title: Trump attacks on law firms begin to chill pro bono work on causes he doesn't like
item.description: The ripple effects of Trump's actions targeting specific law firms already are being felt beyond boardrooms, in declining interest in pro bono work for causes that are unpopular with the president.
item.content:encoded:
The ripple effects of Trump's actions targeting specific law firms already are being felt beyond boardrooms, in declining interest in pro bono work for causes that are unpopular with the president.

(Image credit: Jabin Botsford)
item.dc:creator: Ryan Lucas

item.title: Israel strikes a hospital in Gaza, forcing evacuation as strikes intensify
item.description: The strike hit Al-Ahli Hospital in Gaza City, after Israel issued an evacuation warning. Israel said it struck a command and control center used by Hamas at the hospital.
item.content:encoded:
The strike hit Al-Ahli Hospital in Gaza City, after Israel issued an evacuation warning. Israel said it struck a command and control center used by Hamas at the hospital.

(Image credit: Jehad Alshrafi)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Trump admin tells judge man wrongly deported to El Salvador is alive, still detained
item.description: On Friday, federal judge Paula Xinis had ordered the Trump administration to provide daily updates to return Kilmar Armando Abrego Garcia to the United States.
item.content:encoded:
On Friday, federal judge Paula Xinis had ordered the Trump administration to provide daily updates to return Kilmar Armando Abrego Garcia to the United States.

(Image credit: Alex Wong)
item.dc:creator: Chandelis Duster

item.title: Trump urges Congress to make daylight saving time permanent
item.description: President Trump said Congress should "push hard for more Daylight at the end of a day" in a post on Truth Social.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump said Congress should "push hard for more Daylight at the end of a day" in a post on Truth Social.

(Image credit: Chris Delmas)
item.dc:creator: Chandelis Duster

item.title: Intellectually disabled teen shot by Idaho police dies after being removed from life support
item.description: An autistic, nonverbal teenage boy who was shot repeatedly by Idaho police from the other side of a chain link fence while he was holding a knife died Saturday after being removed from life support, his family said.
item.content:encoded:
An autistic, nonverbal teenage boy who was shot repeatedly by Idaho police from the other side of a chain link fence while he was holding a knife died Saturday after being removed from life support, his family said.

(Image credit: Ana L Vazquez)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
